info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN, EFFINGHAM, HAMPTON, COLLETON, ALLENDALE AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 156 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ruffin to near Lena to near Captolo, and moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Walterboro, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Colleton, Varnville, Estill, Gifford and Newington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
